long_desc.thetext:
What steps will reproduce the problem? 1. Made another task active 2. 3.
-- Error Details -- Date: Tue Jan 29 14:01:07 PST 2013 Message: Restoring of editor state failed Severity: Error Product: Eclipse 1.5.1.20121004-1506 (org.eclipse.epp.package.java.product) Plugin: org.eclipse.mylyn.context.ui Session Data: eclipse.buildId=M20120914-1800 java.version=1.7.0_11 java.vendor=Oracle Corporation BootLoader constants: OS=linux, ARCH=x86_64, WS=gtk, NL=en_US Framework arguments: -product org.eclipse.epp.package.java.product Command-line arguments: -os linux -ws gtk -arch x86_64 -product org.eclipse.epp.package.java.product

id=null name=null at org.eclipse.ui.internal.WorkbenchPage.openEditors(WorkbenchPage.java:4435) ... 67 more

Thanks for the report. From the message above it looks like you are using Eclipse 4.2.1 which shouldn't have the API that is being invoked. What is the version of the org.eclipse.ui.workbench bundle that you have installed? Which version of Mylyn do you have installed?

org.eclipse.ui.workbench: 3.104.0.v20121219-151754 Mylyn: 3.8.3.v20130107-0100
I also have Tasktop Pro: 2.6.0.20130117-0506-RELEASE

I'm putting this on 3.10 to investigate if there is something we can do to make editor restore more robust. To avoid getting spamed with error reports I'm suggesting that we lower severity of editor restore related errors to warnings: https://git.eclipse.org/r/#/c/13704/.
